stimulusHtml: If, instead, the switch is open with the capacitor still fully charged when the slab is inserted, what changes, if any, occur?

features.html: A parallel-plate capacitor connected to a battery is fully charged with the switch S closed, as shown in the circuit above. A slab of dielectric constant K > 1 is slowly inserted between the plates of the capacitor.

choicesHtml:
Potential Difference Across the Plates Charge on Positive Plate
Remains the same Increases
Potential Difference Across the Plates Charge on Positive Plate
Remains the same Decreases
Potential Difference Across the Plates Charge on Positive Plate
Increases Remains the same
Potential Difference Across the Plates Charge on Positive Plate
Decreases Increases
Potential Difference Across the Plates Charge on Positive Plate
Decreases Remains the same
